title: How Bitcoin is boosting financial inclusion & empowering the unbanked - Business Insider Africa
content:
Many people, especially in developing countries, face many challenges when accessing financial services. Unfortunately, the inability to access financial services and loans hinder them from participating in economic activities. The World Bank's 2017 report indicated that 1.7 billion adults are unbanked globally. These individuals need access to financial services like credit and savings accounts to start and grow businesses.

This report showed that 56% of the unbanked adults are in China, Bangladesh, Mexico, Indonesia, India, Pakistan, and Nigeria. Limited financial literacy, strict regulations, inadequate infrastructure, and poverty are some of the reasons for financial exclusion. Unfortunately, most unbanked people use risky, expensive, and unreliable financial services.

How Bitcoin Boosts Financial Inclusion to Empower the Unbanked

ADVERTISEMENT

When Satoshi Nakamoto launched Bitcoin, they had this notion in mind. They knew that accessing and using financial services reduces poverty while enhancing economic growth. While Bitcoin dominates the crypto world, other digital currencies have emerged. Some are even products of various countries' central banks. For instance, you can invest and try luck in oil trading with online trading apps like Oil Profit. Nevertheless, many see Bitcoin as the beacon of hope for those with limited access to financial services. Here's why.

Easy Access

Bitcoin allows individuals to access and use financial services from their mobile devices. To set up a crypto wallet and start receiving Bitcoin, you require a Smartphone that connects to the internet. That way, you can receive Bitcoin payments and transfer them. Also, you can join crypto exchanges to trade Bitcoin for profits.

Currently, several decentralized finance platforms provide various services to the unbanked. For instance, you can use these platforms to save money and access loans and insurance without the restrictions of traditional banks.

Faster and Low-Cost Transactions

ADVERTISEMENT

Conventional financial institutions charge high fees for most transactions, including international remittances. Bitcoin does not require intermediaries because transactions are peer-to-peer, reducing costs significantly. When El Salvador made Bitcoin a legal tender, citizens' remittance costs dropped by 65%. Thus, even small businesses can lower transaction costs by embracing Bitcoin as a payment method.

Besides, Bitcoin transactions are faster because they do not involve intermediaries. Miners validate Bitcoin transactions within minutes. Thus, merchants can receive payments faster and invest funds in their operations by embracing this cryptocurrency.

Borderless Transactions

Bitcoin's decentralized network facilitates cross-border transactions without intermediaries. This cryptocurrency enables individuals to transfer and receive funds globally without traditional bank accounts. And this is particularly beneficial for individuals in places with limited conventional banking infrastructure and migrants.

Financial Empowerment

ADVERTISEMENT

Satoshi Nakamoto wanted people to enjoy total control over their finances. This cryptocurrency can act as your bank. And you can access it anytime, anywhere. And this is particularly vital for people in places with economic and political instability or limited banking access. Bitcoin enables you to preserve wealth, enjoy financial autonomy, and protect your investment against inflation.

Entrepreneurship Opportunities

The unbanked population can access the global economy by embracing Bitcoin. This digital currency enables individuals to engage in digital entrepreneurship by fostering the creation and growth of new business models. And this promotes economic growth by creating opportunities that individuals can exploit and boost their livelihoods.

Final Word

Bitcoin is a beacon of hope for the unbanked populations in many countries. It promotes financial inclusion by enabling borderless transactions, enhancing access to financial services, empowering people with financial autonomy, and reducing transaction costs. If the unbanked population embraces Bitcoin, it can exploit the opportunities that Bitcoin presents and achieve economic empowerment by participating in global economic activities. Nevertheless, understanding how this virtual currency works and the economic growth opportunities it presents is vital for unbanked and financially excluded people to benefit from it.

ADVERTISEMENT

--

title: Is Blackrock Manipulating Bitcoin Price? Mark Yusko Answers - Coinpedia Fintech News
content:
Elena is an expert in technical analysis and risk management in cryptocurrency market. She has 10+year experience in writing - accordingly she is avid journalists with a passion towards researching new insights coming into crypto erena.

The recent events in the cryptocurrency markets have led to the decline of Bitcoin’s price after reaching a local peak. The market was influenced by a series of positive news that created a euphoric sentiment among investors, such as BlackRock’s ETF application, Ripple’s victory against the SEC, and other developments.

However, Mark Yusko, Founder, CEO, and Chief Investment Officer of Morgan Creek Capital, has now answered if this was a natural market cycle or a result of some hidden agenda by insiders who bought earlier and sold at the top. He also talks about the role of BlackRock and other institutions in the market dynamics.

In an interview with the host of Altcoin Daily, Mark said that what really smart investors have done over the years is they actually go out and short a little bit of the asset and then tell everybody how crappy the asset is in interviews and stuff, and then go buy it when the price goes down.

So, if you were somebody who was on the verge of being approved for an ETF and you were going to take massive shares and you wanted to buy the asset cheap, you might be contributing to downward pressure in the short run. He thinks that it probably wasn’t BlackRock or others buying that was pushing it up, but rather people.

He still thinks that BlackRock will be the first one approved. One of the challenges of Bitcoin is that it is pretty closely held, so not much of the total market cap actually changes hands on a day-to-day basis.

Mark mentioned that people are getting back to fundamentals and saying that all the selling that was going to happen has happened and all of the liquidations and some leverage happened when they put Binance in the corner.

title: Bitcoin Cash Price Prediction as BCH Breaches $200 Resistance – Time to Buy? - Cryptonews
content:
Bitcoin Cash Price Prediction as BCH Breaches $200 Resistance – Time to Buy?

Bitcoin Cash / Source: TradingView

Bitcoin Cash (BCH), the cryptocurrency that powers the Bitcoin Cash layer-1 blockchain that was created back in August 2017 after a hard fork from the original Bitcoin blockchain amid concerns about Bitcoin’s scalability and transaction speed, is trying to get back above the $200 mark.

It was last changing hands close to $199 and is broadly flat on the day, after finding strong resistance around $210 on Tuesday, when the BCH bulls failed to push the cryptocurrency back to the north of its 100 and 50DMAs and downtrend from the late June high.

BCH has been in a downtrend since a massive pump in June, which was at the time attributed to news that BCH will be one of the few cryptocurrencies listed on by crypto exchange EDX Markets.

EDX Markets, which is backed by a number of major financial institutions like Fidelity, Charles Schwab and Citadel, launched just a few months ago and observers think that the exchange will be looked on more favorably by regulators than its competitors like Coinbase.

Price Prediction – Where Next for Bitcoin Cash (BCH)?

BCH’s failure to muster a meaningful break back to the north of the $200 level, as well as above the key aforementioned resistance levels is a concerning sign for the cryptocurrency’s near-term price prospects, and price predictions look set to remain bearish as a result.

Indeed, BCH looks on course to retest recent lows in the $160 area, should the cryptocurrency continue to fail to snap its recent downtrend.

This is a key support zone, marked by the July 2022 highs and August 2023 lows, while the 200DMA also resides in this area.

If the bulls were to aggressively buy BCH upon a retest of $160, that would be a strong sign that the bull market ignited back in June remains intact.

If not, a fallback to the low $100s and back into the late-2022/early-2023 ranges is on the cards.

Time to Buy Bitcoin Cash (BCH)?

Given the prospect of likely further declines for BCH, crypto investors willing to exercise some patience may want to wait to buy Bitcoin Cash.

As mentioned above, $160 could be a much better area to get involved, as this could easily mark a near-term price low.

Alternatives to Consider

It’s always smart for crypto investors to hedge their bets, given the unpredictability of the market.

One excellent Bitcoin Cash (BCH) alternative that crypto investors should consider is a new coin being launched by Wall Street Memes, one of the internet’s largest retail investing communities.

Wall Street Memes, with its over 1 million following across various social media channels, has traditionally described itself as “the king of stonks” (stocks for the uninitiated), but is also looking to claim the crown of being “the king of crypto”, with the launch of its very own meme coin token $WSM.

The presale of $WSM has been a resounding success, with over $25 million raised, and dozens of major crypto industry influencers and analysts backing the coin for major success.

And investors are running out of time to get involved, with the presale scheduled to end in under 14 days.
